text.p: To enter a vector such as [mathjaxinline]\left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline], you can either:

li.p: enter it as you would a [mathjaxinline]3\times 1[/mathjaxinline] matrix: [[1],[2],[3]]
or, you can enter it as <1,2,3>

font.p: Note the special nature of vector [mathjaxinline]y[/mathjaxinline]. We can see that the product [mathjaxinline]Ay[/mathjaxinline] will equal the third column of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] for not just this matrix, but any matrix [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] with four columns.
